translation.en: In the afternoon, the rat man came to the petrol station.
translation.ja: その午後 ネズミ男は給油所へ

translation.en: He sidled up the driveway with a soft, stealthy gait. His feet made no noise at all on the gravel.
translation.ja: 柔らかな足取りでコソコソと 砂利道を音も立てずに

translation.en: He had an army knapsack slung over one shoulder. He wore an old- fashioned corduroy jacket with large pockets.
translation.ja: 肩には軍用のナップサック 古臭いコール天の上着

translation.en: Corduroy trousers were tied around the knees with lengths of white string.
translation.ja: ズボンの膝には 紐(ひも)を巻いている

translation.en: - Hello? - Yes?
translation.ja: どうも

translation.en: Rodent operative.
translation.ja: 駆除だ

translation.en: His small, dark eyes moved swiftly over the premises.
translation.ja: 小さな目が店を見回す

translation.en: - The rat man? - That's me.
translation.ja: ネズミ捕り？

translation.en: He was lean, leathery, a sharp face,
translation.ja: ヤセて顔の線が鋭く⸺

translation.en: two long, sulfur- yellow teeth protruding from the upper jaw over the lower lip.
translation.ja: ２本の黄色い歯が 下唇にかぶさっている

translation.en: His ears were round and thin, set near the back of his head.
translation.ja: 耳は丸く うなじ側にある

translation.en: The eyes were almost black, but when they looked at you, there was a flash of yellow in them.
translation.ja: 目は ほぼ黒だが 人を見る時は黄色く光った

translation.en: - You've come quick. - Special orders from the Health Office.
translation.ja: 早いね 衛生局からだ

translation.en: And now you're going to catch all the rats?
translation.ja: ネズミを全部 捕るか？

translation.en: - Yeah. - How?
translation.ja: 方法は？

translation.en: Depends what rats, where they is. Different methods for different rats.
translation.ja: ネズミの居場所によるさ

translation.en: - Trap them, I suppose. - What?
translation.ja: ワナを？

translation.en: - Trap 'em. - Trap 'em?
translation.ja: ワナ？

translation.en: The rat man snorted.
translation.ja: 鼻で笑う

translation.en: Won't catch 'em that way. Rats ain't rabbits.
translation.ja: ウサギじゃないぜ

translation.en: He held his face up high, sniffing the air with a nose that twitched perceptibly from side to side.
translation.ja: 顔を上げ 鼻をひくつかせて 空気の匂いをかいだ

translation.en: Rats is clever. You wanna catch 'em, you gotta know 'em.
translation.ja: ネズミは賢い 捕まえたけりゃ⸺

translation.en: You gotta know rats on this job.
translation.ja: 知識が要る

translation.en: You know what they do? They watch you.
translation.ja: 奴らは人間を見てる

translation.en: Whole time you're preparin' how to exterminate 'em, they're watchin' you.
translation.ja: 駆除の準備をしてる間も じっとな

translation.en: This ain't a sewer job, is it?
translation.ja: 下水仕事か？

translation.en: No, it's not a sewer job.
translation.ja: そうじゃない

translation.en: - Tricky things, sewer jobs. - I shouldn't think so.
translation.ja: 下水は厄介だ そうかな

translation.en: You shouldn't, should you? I'd like to see you do a sewer job.
translation.ja: 違うと思うなら やってみな

translation.en: Just exactly how'd you set about it, I'd like to know.
translation.ja: どうやるか教えてくれ

translation.en: Poison them, I suppose.
translation.ja: 毒を置く

translation.en: And where exactly would you put the poison?
translation.ja: 具体的に どこへ？

translation.en: Down the sewer?
translation.ja: 下水だ

translation.en: The rat man sparkled, triumphant.
translation.ja: 彼は勝ち誇る

translation.en: Yeah, I knew it. Down the sewer.
translation.ja: やっぱりな

translation.en: Know what'd happen? Get washed away completely. All your poison. Sewer's like a river.
translation.ja: どうなると思う？ 川みたいに流される

translation.en: All right. Well, what would you do, Mr. Rat Man? On a sewer job?
translation.ja: じゃ どうする？ ネズミ男さん

translation.en: The rat man advanced a step closer.
translation.ja: 彼は前へ出て⸺

translation.en: His voice became secretive and confidential, the voice of a man divulging professional secrets.
translation.ja: 業務上の秘密を明かす 秘密めいた声になった

translation.en: You works on the understandin' a rat is a gnawin' animal, see? Anythin' you give 'em, they gnaws on it.
translation.ja: ネズミは かじる動物だ 何を与えられても かじる

translation.en: So you got a sewer job on your hands. What d'you do?
translation.ja: さあ 下水仕事だ どうやる？

translation.en: His voice had the soft, throaty sound of a croaking frog,
translation.ja: カエルのような喉声(のどごえ)と⸺

translation.en: and he seemed to speak all his words with a wet- lipped relish, as if they tasted good on the tongue.
translation.ja: 湿った唇で言葉を 味わうかのような話し方

translation.en: You go down the sewer and you take along some ordinary brown paper bags
translation.ja: 普通の茶色い紙袋を 持って入る

translation.en: filled with plaster of paris powder. Nothin' else.
translation.ja: 中身は石膏(せっこう)の粉だ

translation.en: Then you suspend 'em from the roof of the sewer
translation.ja: そいつをぶら下げる

translation.en: so they hangs down not quite touchin' the water. Just high enough so a rat can reach 'em.
translation.ja: 水に浸からず ネズミが届く高さにな

translation.en: Claud was listening, rapt.
translation.ja: クロードは聞く

translation.en: Old rat comes swimmin' along the sewer, sees the bag. He stops.
translation.ja: ネズミは泳いできて 袋を見つけ 止まる

translation.en: Takes a sniff at it. It don't smell so bad.
translation.ja: 悪いニオイじゃない どうする？

translation.en: - What's he do? - He gnaws it.
translation.ja: 悪いニオイじゃない どうする？ かじる

translation.en: That's it! He starts gnawin' at the bag, and the bag breaks,
translation.ja: そうだ　かじると 袋が破れて⸺

translation.en: and the old rat gets a mouthful of powder for his pains.
translation.ja: 口一杯に苦痛の粉をほおばる

translation.en: Well?
translation.ja: それで？

translation.en: Well, that does him.
translation.ja: おしまいだ

translation.en: - That kills him? - Stone dead.
translation.ja: 死ぬ？

translation.en: - Plaster of paris… - It swells when you wet it.
translation.ja: 石膏で？ 石膏は⸺

translation.en: Gets into the rat's tubes and swells right up and kills him quicker than anythin' in the world.
translation.ja: 濡れると膨らむ 胃袋に入りゃネズミは即死

translation.en: That's where you got to know rats.
translation.ja: これが知識さ

translation.en: His face glowed with a shifty pride.
translation.ja: “どうだ”という顔だ

translation.en: He rubbed his stringy fingers together, holding the hands up close to his face.
translation.ja: 筋張った指を合わせ 顔に近づける

translation.en: Now, where's them rats?
translation.ja: さて ネズミはどこだ？

translation.en: The word rats came out with a rich, fruity sound as if he were gargling with melted butter.
translation.ja: 溶かしバターで うがいをするような響き

translation.en: In the hayrick across the road.
translation.ja: 干し草の中だ

translation.en: - Not inside? - Only in the hayrick. Nowhere else.
translation.ja: 野外か 干し草だ

translation.en: I'll wager they're inside too, gettin' in your food, spreadin' disease.
translation.ja: 家の食い物も荒らして 病気をまいてる

translation.en: - Got any sickness here? - He looked pointedly at me, then at Claud.
translation.ja: 体調は？ 厳しい目つきだ

translation.en: - Everyone's well. - Quite sure?
translation.ja: 上々さ

translation.en: - Quite sure. - You never know.
translation.ja: 本当だ 怪しい

translation.en: He'd taken upon himself the mantle of a public health officer, disappointed we were not suffering from bubonic plague.
translation.ja: 衛生局員気取りで 我々が健康なのを残念がった

translation.en: Nevertheless, the rats are in the hayrick. How will you remove them?
translation.ja: ネズミは干し草の中だ どうやる？

translation.en: The rat man grinned a crafty, toothy grin.
translation.ja: 歯を見せてニヤリとし⸺

translation.en: He reached into his knapsack and withdrew a large tin, weighing it up and down in his hands as he spoke.
translation.ja: ナップサックから缶を出すと 重さを量るように動かす

translation.en: Poison. Special poison. Deadly poison.
translation.ja: 毒だ　特別な猛毒

translation.en: They'd put you inside if they caught you with even a spoonful of this.
translation.ja: スプーン１杯の所持で 禁錮６ヵ月

translation.en: There's enough here to kill a million men. - Want to see? - Yes, please.
translation.ja: こいつは100万人 殺せる 見るか？

translation.en: He took a penny and prized open the lid.
translation.ja: 硬貨で こじ開ける

translation.en: There it is.
translation.ja: ほら

translation.en: He spoke almost lovingly of the stuff and held it forward for Claud.
translation.ja: いとしそうな口ぶりで 彼に見せる

translation.en: Corn or barley, is it?
translation.ja: トウモロコシか？

translation.en: Oats. Oats soaked in deadly poison.
translation.ja: オーツ麦を浸してる

translation.en: You take just one grain in your mouth and you're a goner in three minutes.
translation.ja: １粒でも口に入れたら ３分で死ぬ

translation.en: Never out of me sight, this tin.
translation.ja: だから慎重に扱う

translation.en: He caressed the tin and shook it…
translation.ja: 缶をなでて軽く振る

translation.en: - - …so the oat grains rustled softly inside.
translation.ja: 麦がやさしく鳴った

translation.en: But your rats don't get this today. They wouldn't have it, anyway.
translation.ja: 今日は与えない 食わないしな

translation.en: That's where you got to know rats. Rats is suspicious. Terrible suspicious.
translation.ja: これも知識だ ネズミは ひどく疑り深い

translation.en: So today they get some nice, clean, tasty oats as will do 'em no harm in the world.
translation.ja: だから今日は うまくて害のない麦をやる

translation.en: Fatten 'em up, that's all. And tomorrow, the same again. And the day after that, and the day after that.
translation.ja: そうやって太らせて 明日も 次も その次も同じのをやる

translation.en: And it'll taste so good, all the rats in the district will be comin' along soon enough.
translation.ja: うまいから そこら中の ネズミがやって来る

translation.en: Very clever.
translation.ja: 賢いな

translation.en: You got to be clever on this job, cleverer than a rat. And that's saying something.
translation.ja: この仕事じゃ ネズミより賢くないとな

translation.en: You've almost got to be a rat yourself.
translation.ja: “もうネズミだね” 私は彼の顔を見ていたので 思わず口が滑った

translation.en: It slipped out before I could stop myself. I couldn't help it, I was looking at him at the time.
translation.ja: 私は彼の顔を見ていたので 思わず口が滑った

translation.en: The effect it had on him was surprising.
translation.ja: でも彼の反応は…

translation.en: - That's it! - …he cried.
translation.ja: そうとも

translation.en: Now you got it, you really said somethin'. A good ratter's gotta be more like a rat than anythin' else.
translation.ja: 腕のいいネズミ捕りは 何よりネズミに似てなきゃ

translation.en: Cleverer even than a rat, and that is not an easy thing to be, let me tell you.
translation.ja: ネズミの上を行くってのは 簡単じゃない

translation.en: Well, let's get on with it. Lady Leonora Benson's asking for me urgent up at the manor.
translation.ja: 始めよう　ベンスン邸にも 早く行かないと

translation.en: She's got rats too?
translation.ja: ネズミが？

translation.en: Everybody's got rats.
translation.ja: どこにも出るさ

translation.en: The rat man ambled off down the driveway. The way he walked was so like a rat, it made you wonder.
translation.ja: ゆっくりとした足取りは ネズミに似ていた

translation.en: That slow, almost delicate, ambling walk with a lot of give at the knees
translation.ja: 膝を曲げた 繊細なまでの歩き方

translation.en: and no sound at all from his footsteps on the gravel.
translation.ja: 砂利道でも音を立てない

translation.en: He hopped over the gate, and walked quickly 'round the hayrick, scattering handfuls of oats onto the ground.
translation.ja: 門を飛び越え 干し草の山を 周りながら地面に麦をまく

translation.en: The next day he returned and repeated the procedure.
translation.ja: 翌日も来て繰り返した

translation.en: The day after that he came again, and the day after that,
translation.ja: その翌日も同じだ そして⸺

translation.en: and finally, on the fourth day, he put down the poisoned oats.
translation.ja: ４日目 毒入りの麦をまいた

translation.en: But he didn't scatter these. Instead, he placed them in little piles at each corner of the hayrick.
translation.ja: だが今度は干し草の各隅に 置いて 小さな山を作った

translation.en: - You got a dog? - Yes.
translation.ja: 犬は？ いるよ

translation.en: Well, if you want him to die a horrible, twisting death, let him in that gate.
translation.ja: 犬を悶死させたきゃ 門の中へ入れな

translation.en: The next day he came to collect the dead.
translation.ja: 翌日 死骸を集める

translation.en: Get me an old sack. I'm gonna need one to put 'em in.
translation.ja: 死骸を入れる袋をくれ

translation.en: He was puffed up and important now, the black eyes gleaming with pride.
translation.ja: 得意気だ 黒い目が誇りに輝く

translation.en: He was about to display the results of his catch to the audience.
translation.ja: 自身の成果を見せたいのだ

translation.en: Claud fetched a sack and we walked across the road.
translation.ja: クロードが袋を取ってきた

translation.en: The rat man prowled around the hayrick, bending over to inspect one of his piles of poison.
translation.ja: 男は干し草を周り かがんで毒の山を調べた

translation.en: - Something wrong here. - …he muttered.
translation.ja: 変だぞ ソフトだが怒りを含んだ声

translation.en: His voice was soft and angry.
translation.ja: ソフトだが怒りを含んだ声

translation.en: He ambled over to another pile and got down to examine it closely.
translation.ja: 別の山へ歩いて仔細に調べる

translation.en: - Something wrong here. - What's the matter?
translation.ja: ひどく変だ どうした？

translation.en: He didn't answer, but it was clear the rats hadn't touched his bait.
translation.ja: 明らかに毒が食われていない

translation.en: These are very clever rats here, I said.
translation.ja: “賢すぎる種(しゅ)だ”と私

translation.en: The rat man was annoyed
translation.ja: 彼は⸺

translation.en: and showed it on his face and nose and by the way the two yellow teeth were pressing into his lower lip.
translation.ja: 苛立ちが鼻の周りに見え ２本の歯で下唇を押す

translation.en: - Don't give me that crap. - …he said, looking at me.
translation.ja: バカな 私に言った

translation.en: Nothing's wrong with these rats, somebody's feedin' 'em. They got somethin' juicy to eat somewhere, plenty of it.
translation.ja: ネズミは同じだ　誰かが うまいエサをやってるんだ

translation.en: No rats in the world will turn down oats unless their bellies is full to burstin'.
translation.ja: 腹一杯でなきゃ オーツ麦は必ず食う

translation.en: The rat man turned away, sullen.
translation.ja: 不機嫌そうに⸺

translation.en: He knelt down again scooping up the poisoned oats with a small shovel, tipping it carefully back into a tin.
translation.ja: シャベルで毒入り麦をすくい 慎重に缶へ戻す

translation.en: When he had finished, all three of us walked back across the road.
translation.ja: それが終わると３人で戻った

translation.en: The rat man stood by the petrol- pump, a rather sorry, humble rat man now
translation.ja: 給油ポンプの横に立ち 今や謙虚な男

translation.en: whose face was beginning to take on a brooding aspect.
translation.ja: 陰気な顔つきだ

translation.en: He had withdrawn into himself over his failure,
translation.ja: 失敗に黙りこくり⸺

translation.en: the eyes veiled and wicked, the little tongue darting out to one side of the two yellow teeth.
translation.ja: 邪悪な目で ２本の歯から 舌を出している

translation.en: He looked up at me, a surreptitious glance, then over at Claud.
translation.ja: 私とクロードを ちらりと見た

translation.en: His nose- end twitched, sniffing the air. He raised himself up and down on his toes, swaying gently,
translation.ja: 鼻で空気の匂いをかぎ 爪先立ちで上下すると⸺

translation.en: and in a soft voice, soft and secretive, he said…
translation.ja: 秘密めかした声で言った

translation.en: You want to see something?
translation.ja: 見たいか？

translation.en: He was trying to retrieve his reputation.
translation.ja: 名誉挽回を狙っている

translation.en: - What? - You want to see something amazing?
translation.ja: 何を？ すごいものだ

translation.en: He put his right hand into the poacher's pocket of his jacket
translation.ja: ポケットに 右手を突っ込むと⸺

translation.en: and brought out a large, live rat clasped tight between his fingers.
translation.ja: 生きたネズミを つまみ出した

translation.en: Good God!
translation.ja: 驚いたな

translation.en: That's it. You see?
translation.ja: これだ

translation.en: He was crouching slightly and craning his neck forward and leering at us and holding this enormous brown rat,
translation.ja: 前かがみ気味でニヤリと笑い その大きなネズミを持つ

translation.en: one finger and thumb making a tight circle around its neck, clamping its head so it couldn't turn and bite.
translation.ja: 咬(か)まれぬように２本の指で 首をしっかり固定して

translation.en: Do you go around with rats in your pockets?
translation.ja: ネズミを持ち歩く？

translation.en: Always a rat or two about me somewhere.
translation.ja: いつも１～２匹な

translation.en: He put his free hand into the other pocket and produced a small, white…
translation.ja: もう１つのポケットに 手を入れ…

translation.en: - Is that a ferret? - The rat man snickered, hissing.
translation.ja: フェレット？ 鼻先で笑う男

translation.en: The ferret seemed to know him and stayed still.
translation.ja: フェレットは じっとしていた

translation.en: Nothing will kill a rat quicker than a ferret.
translation.ja: ネズミを瞬殺する

translation.en: He held the two animals close in front of him so the ferret's nose came within six inches of the rat's face.
translation.ja: ネズミの15センチほどまで フェレットの鼻を近づけた

translation.en: The pink beady eyes of the ferret stared at the rat. The rat struggled, trying to edge away from the killer.
translation.ja: フェレットの目がネズミを 見つめ ネズミはもがいた

translation.en: - Now. - …he said.
translation.ja: さあて

translation.en: Watch.
translation.ja: 見てな

translation.en: His khaki shirt was open at the neck, and he lifted the rat and slipped it down inside, next to his skin.
translation.ja: シャツの襟元から裸の胸へ ネズミを滑り込ませた

translation.en: His belt prevented the rat from going lower than his waist.
translation.ja: ネズミはベルトに阻まれる

translation.en: He slipped the ferret in next. Immediately, there was a great commotion inside the shirt.
translation.ja: フェレットを入れると シャツ内で大騒動が

translation.en: It appeared the rat was running around his body, chased by the ferret.
translation.ja: ネズミが 逃げ回っているようだ

translation.en: Six or seven times they went around, the small bulge chasing the larger one,
translation.ja: 小さな膨らみが ６～７周 追いかけ⸺

translation.en: gaining on it slightly each circuit, drawing closer and closer until at last the two bulges seemed to come together,
translation.ja: １周ごとに差を詰めると ついに もう１つと合体した

translation.en: and there was a scuffle and a series of shrill shrieks.
translation.ja: 格闘と甲高い鳴き声

translation.en: Throughout this performance, the rat man stood absolutely still,
translation.ja: この間 男は微動だにせず⸺

translation.en: legs apart, arms hanging loosely, dark eyes resting calmly on Claud's frozen face.
translation.ja: 脚を広げ 両腕を垂らし クロードに目を向けていた

translation.en: Finally, he took his hand and reached down into his shirt and pulled out the ferret.
translation.ja: ようやくシャツに手を入れ フェレットを取りだす

translation.en: With the other, he took out the dead rat.
translation.ja: 死んだネズミもだ

translation.en: There were traces of blood around the white muzzle of the ferret.
translation.ja: フェレットの 鼻の周りには血が

translation.en: Not sure I liked that very much, I said.
translation.ja: “楽しめないよ”と私

translation.en: You never seen nothin' like it before, I'll bet you that.
translation.ja: でも こんなの初めてだろ

translation.en: Can't say I have.
translation.ja: 確かに

translation.en: You'll get a nasty nip in the guts one of these days.
translation.ja: そのうち腹を咬まれる

translation.en: …Claud told him, but was intrigued, and the rat man was becoming cocky again.
translation.ja: だが彼の感心ぶりに 調子を戻し…

translation.en: You want to see something far more amazing? Something you'd never believe unless you're seeing it with your own eyes?
translation.ja: もっと見るか　自分の目で 見なきゃ信じられないぞ

translation.en: I glanced at Claud more than slightly apprehensive.
translation.ja: 私は不安気に彼を見た

translation.en: Yes.
translation.ja: ああ

translation.en: The rat man slipped the dead rat into one pocket and the ferret into the other.
translation.ja: ネズミとフェレットを ポケットへ

translation.en: Then he reached into his knapsack and produced a second live rat.
translation.ja: ナップサックから 別のネズミを出した

translation.en: Holy Christ!
translation.ja: まさか！

translation.en: Always got one or two rats about me somewhere.
translation.ja: いつも持ち歩いてる

translation.en: You got to know rats on this job, and if you wanna know 'em you gotta have 'em around.
translation.ja: ネズミを知りたきゃ そばに置くことさ

translation.en: This is a sewer rat, this one. An old sewer rat, clever as buggery.
translation.ja: 老いたドブネズミだ とても賢い

translation.en: See him watchin' me all the time, wonderin' what I'm gonna do next?
translation.ja: 俺が何をするか じっと見てるだろ

translation.en: - See him? - Most unpleasant.
translation.ja: 不気味だ

translation.en: What will you do? I had a feeling I'd like this demonstration less than the last one.
translation.ja: “何をする？”と私 さっきのより不愉快かも

translation.en: - Fetch me a piece of string. - Claud fetched a piece of string.
translation.ja: 紐をくれ クロードが渡すと ネズミの後ろ足に結ぶ

translation.en: The rat man looped it around the rat's hind leg.
translation.ja: クロードが渡すと ネズミの後ろ足に結ぶ

translation.en: The rat struggled, but the rat man held it tight.
translation.ja: ネズミは もがくがムダだ

translation.en: Now, you got a table inside?
translation.ja: 中に机は？

translation.en: We don't want the rat inside, I said.
translation.ja: “中は勘弁だ”と私

translation.en: Well, I need a table. Or somethin' flat, anyway.
translation.ja: 平たい物ならいい

translation.en: We walked over to the petrol- pump and he put the sewer rat on top.
translation.ja: 給油ポンプに ネズミを置き⸺

translation.en: He attached the string to a post so the rat was now tethered.
translation.ja: 杭(くい)に足の紐を結んで つないだ

translation.en: At first, it crouched, unmoving and suspicious,
translation.ja: 最初 ネズミは動かなかった

translation.en: a big- bodied gray rat with bright black eyes and a scaly tail that lay in a long curl on the metal surface.
translation.ja: 大きな灰色の体に黒い目で 曲がった尾を横たえ⸺

translation.en: It was looking away, but watching him sideways to see what he was going to do.
translation.ja: 顔を背け 男の行動を 横目で見ている

translation.en: The rat man stepped back a few paces, and immediately the rat relaxed.
translation.ja: 彼が下がると すぐ緊張を解いた

translation.en: It sat up on its haunches and began to lick the gray fur on its chest.
translation.ja: 尻を付き 胸の灰色の毛をナメて⸺

translation.en: Then it scratched its muzzle with both front paws.
translation.ja: 両前足で鼻をこする

translation.en: It seemed quite unconcerned about the other men standing nearby.
translation.ja: 我々など いないも同然だ

translation.en: - How about a little bet? - …the rat man said.
translation.ja: “賭けないか” 男が言う

translation.en: No, thank you. I said.
translation.ja: “結構だ”と私

translation.en: - It's more fun if you bet. - What do you want to bet on?
translation.ja: 賭けると楽しい 対象は？

translation.en: I can kill that rat without using my hands. I'll put 'em in my pockets and not use 'em.
translation.ja: 手を使わずネズミを殺せるか 俺は手を隠す

translation.en: It was apparent the rat man was out to earn some money.
translation.ja: 小遣い稼ぎに違いない

translation.en: I looked at the rat that was to be killed and began to feel sick,
translation.ja: ネズミを見て 気分が悪くなった

translation.en: not because it was going to be killed, but because it was to be killed in a special way,
translation.ja: ただ殺されるからでなく その方法の⸺

translation.en: with a considerable degree of enthusiasm.
translation.ja: 熱量の大きさに

translation.en: - No arms? - No arms, no legs, no hands neither.
translation.ja: 腕は？ 使わない　脚も手も

translation.en: - You'll sit on it. - No squashing.
translation.ja: つぶす？ 違う

translation.en: - Let's see it. - Bet me a quid first.
translation.ja: 見よう １ポンドを

translation.en: Don't be bloody daft. Why should we?
translation.ja: まさか

translation.en: - What'll you bet? - Zero. Nothing.
translation.ja: 何を？ 何もだ

translation.en: All right. Then it's a no- go.
translation.ja: じゃ やめよう

translation.en: - He made as if to untie the string. - I'll bet a shilling.
translation.ja: 紐に手を １シリング

translation.en: The sick sensation in my stomach was increasing.
translation.ja: 胃の不快感が増す

translation.en: But there was an awful magnetism about this business. I found myself unable to walk away or even move.
translation.ja: だが出来事のあまりの磁力に 体が固まっている

translation.en: - You too? - No.
translation.ja: あんたも？

translation.en: Want me to do this for a shilling?
translation.ja: 小銭でやれと？

translation.en: - I don't want you to do it. - Where's the money?
translation.ja: 望まない 金は？

translation.en: Claud put a shilling on the petrol- pump. The rat man laid two sixpences beside Claud's money.
translation.ja: クロードは１シリング硬貨 男は６ペンスを２枚

translation.en: Bet's on.
translation.ja: よし

translation.en: Claud and I stepped back. The rat man stepped forward, put his hands in his pockets
translation.ja: 我々は下がり 男は前へ出た

translation.en: and inclined his body from the waist toward the rat.
translation.ja: 上半身を前へ傾ける

translation.en: The rat was crouching, alarmed. It seemed it was preparing to spring at the rat man,
translation.ja: ネズミは うずくまった 飛びかかる準備か

translation.en: but then it began to reverse away,
translation.ja: だが次には⸺

translation.en: dragging its body backwards with crouching steps until the string tautened on its hind leg.
translation.ja: 後ずさりを始めた 紐がピンと張るまで

translation.en: The rat man leaned further towards the rat, following it back and forth with his eyes. Suddenly…
translation.ja: 男は身を乗り出し ネズミを凝視した　突然…

translation.en: - It panicked. - …it panicked and leapt into the air.
translation.ja: パニックだ 横に飛んだ

translation.en: The string pulled it up with a jerk that must've nearly dislocated its leg.
translation.ja: 紐が強く張り ネズミの体は戻された

translation.en: It crouched again at the edge,
translation.ja: うずくまり⸺

translation.en: as far away as the string would allow, whiskers quivering, the long gray body rigid with fear.
translation.ja: 限界まで男から離れ 恐怖で硬直している

translation.en: At this point, the rat man again began to move his face very slowly, closer and closer.
translation.ja: 男は さらにゆっくりと 顔を近づけていく

translation.en: I wanted to cry out for him to stop, but I couldn't speak.
translation.ja: 私は叫び出しそうになった

translation.en: Something extremely unpleasant was about to happen, I was sure of that.
translation.ja: 恐ろしく不愉快なことが 起こる

translation.en: Something sinister and cruel, but I had to see it now.
translation.ja: 何か残酷なことが… だが見ねば

translation.en: Not more than the length of a man's hand was separating the two.
translation.ja: 両者の間は 男の手の長さほど

translation.en: The rat pressed its body flat, tense and terrified.
translation.ja: ネズミは緊張で低姿勢

translation.en: The rat man was also tense, but with a dangerous active tensity that was like a tight- wound spring.
translation.ja: 男の緊張には 固く巻かれた バネのような活力が

translation.en: The shadow of a smile flickered around the skin of his mouth.
translation.ja: 唇には うっすらと笑み

translation.en: Then, suddenly, he struck,
translation.ja: 突如 襲いかかった

translation.en: as a snake strikes, darting his head forward with a swift knife- like stroke…
translation.ja: ヘビのような素早い一撃で 頭を前へ

translation.en: …that originated in the muscles of the lower body…
translation.ja: 下半身の筋力だ

translation.en: …and I had a glimpse of the mouth opening wide…
translation.ja: 口が大きく開く

translation.en: …two yellow teeth…
translation.ja: ２本の歯

translation.en: …the whole face contorted by the effort of mouth- opening.
translation.ja: 大きな口に ゆがんだ顔

translation.en: More than that, I did not care to see.
translation.ja: 私は目を閉じた

translation.en: I closed my eyes, and when I opened them again, the rat was dead,
translation.ja: また開けた時 ネズミは死んでいた

translation.en: the rat man was slipping the money into his pocket and spitting to clear his mouth.
translation.ja: 男は金をしまうと 汚れたツバを吐いた

translation.en: And that's what they makes licorice out of.
translation.ja: こいつが甘みの素だ

translation.en: Rat's blood's what the big factories and chocolate- makers use to make licorice.
translation.ja: チョコ業者も ネズミの血を使ってる

translation.en: Nothin' wrong with a drop of rat's blood.
translation.ja: １滴ぐらい平気さ

translation.en: You are absolutely disgusting.
translation.ja: ヘドが出る

translation.en: But that's it, you see. You eaten it many a time.
translation.ja: でも あんたも食ってるぜ

translation.en: Penny sticks and licorice bootlaces all made from rat's blood.
translation.ja: お菓子はみんな ネズミの血だ

translation.en: We don't want to hear another word, thanks.
translation.ja: それ以上 言うな

translation.en: Boiled up in great cauldrons, bubblin' and steamin' and men stirrin' it with long poles.
translation.ja: 大釜でボコボコ煮立たせ 長い棒でかき混ぜる

translation.en: One of the big secrets of the chocolate factories,
translation.ja: チョコ工場の秘密だ

translation.en: and no one knows about it, except the ratters supplyin' the stuff.
translation.ja: ネズミ捕りが 血を供給してるのさ

translation.en: Suddenly he noticed his audience was no longer with him.
translation.ja: 急に男は気づいた

translation.en: Our faces were hostile and sick- looking and crimson with anger.
translation.ja: 怒りで紅潮した我々の顔に

translation.en: He stopped and turned away without another word.
translation.ja: 話をやめて背を向け⸺

translation.en: We watched as he sloped onto the road with a slow, delicate, ambling walk.
translation.ja: 繊細な ゆっくりした 足取りで道路へ歩いた

translation.en: His footsteps didn't make a sound, not even on the gravel.
translation.ja: 砂利道を音も立てずに

translation.en: Strange.
translation.ja: 不思議だ

translation.en: The rats never ate the poisoned oats.
translation.ja: 毒麦は残っていた

translation.en: There must be something nutritious in the hayrick.
translation.ja: 干し草に何か栄養物が あるのかも
